title: Gordon Ramsay's daughter Tilly 'dating' Gino D'Acampo's son Luciano
text:
Gordon Ramsay's teenage daughter Matilda has been 'dating' Gino D'Acampo's son Luciano.

The TV personality, 52, revealed his youngest daughter, 17, has struck up a romance with his fellow chef's child, also 17, after meeting on the set of their fathers' joint ITV food show, Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip.

Branding the situation a 'f**king nightmare', Gordon said he was surprised by the turn of events during an interview on The Jonathan Ross Show last week.

Unimpressed: Gordon Ramsay has confessed his teenage daughter Matilda has been 'dating' Gino D'Acampo's son Luciano

Joking about whether there was going to be an arranged marriage any time soon, Jonathan told the audience: 'It is Gino's son who is by the way is a very handsome man - I think Gino isn't the father.'

Gordon said: 'We were driving through San Francisco and FaceTiming Luciano and all of a sudden Tilly pops up behind them, and they are out having lunch.

'I think they are friends.'

'I have heard they are more than friends', Jonathan said, drawing laughs from the audience.

The pair then joked about Gino becoming Tilly's father-in-law, no doubt causing the teens much embarrassment as they watched from home.

Connection: The 52-year-old TV personality, 52, revealed his youngest daughter has struck up a romance with his fellow chef's son (pictured left) after meeting on the set of Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip

Runs in the family: Keen to carve out a successful career like her dad, Tilly has released her own cookbook and appeared alongside Gordon on MasterChef Junior

Gino, First Dates host Fred Siriex and Gordon teamed up for the ultimate lads' trip to their home countries of Italy, Scotland and France respectively, introducing one another to their local cuisine.

The first three-part series on ITV aired last year, and the second installment is rumoured to be returning shortly.

Gordon raises children Megan, 21, twins Holly and Jack, 19, Tilly and baby Oscar, five months, with his wife Tana, dividing their time between London and Los Angeles.

Meanwhile, Gino has children Luciano, Rocco, 14, and Mia, seven, with his wife Jessica Stellina Morrison.

Tilly fronts her own TV show on CBBC called Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch, which sees her dad and family members make regular appearances.

Keen to carve out a successful career like her dad, Tilly has also released her own cookbook and has appeared alongside Gordon on MasterChef Junior.

In the limelight: Tilly fronts her own TV show on CBBC called Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch

Chefs on tour: Tilly and Luciano reportedly met when Gino, First Dates host Fred Siriex and Gordon teamed up for the ultimate lads' trip to their home countries of Italy, Scotland and France respectively

She is close friends with the Beckham children and boasts 410,000 followers on Instagram.

Luciano has rarely been seen in public with his famous father Gino; his youngest sister Mia is the foodie in the family and has joined her dad in ad campaigns and for TV appearances.

The fiery tempered chef recently revealed he 'dropped to the floor and blacked out' as the couple welcomed Oscar to the world - which marked the first time he had been present at one of his children's births.

He said: 'Tana didn't want to see me there for previous births, she said 'I don't want you to see me in this state so get out".

'This time around, I was there and I absolutely cr*pped my pants. I fainted. I literally dropped on the floor.

Big day: Gordon recently revealed he 'dropped to the floor and blacked out' as wife Tana gave birth to Oscar in April

'I was sat there and Oscar popped out through the sunroof and then they sort of throw you on him and he's screaming and I fell back, the nurse grabbed me.'

He said: 'Ed Sheeran was playing, I put Ed on to calm everybody. I put Ed on then I blacked out, I fainted like an idiot.

'Have you ever been in the [operating] theatre where there is so much commotion, so much going on? And then bang. I've never fainted in my life, by the way, that was the first time.'

On being present for the birth for the first time, he added: 'It's scary, it's full on also they are experts [the doctors] and I'm a control freak so I was like 'Get me the hell out of here, please.''

Gordon gushed about his new baby son, saying: 'He is six months, it's extraordinary, also for the rest of the kids it's just a welcome bundle of joy. And boy, does that take you back!'
description: The  TV personality, 52, revealed his youngest daughter, 17, has struck up a romance with his fellow chef's child, also 17, after meeting on the set of their fathers' joint ITV show.
